Sam wrote:
> We just updated to the most recent version of Heritrix from CVS on our
> project, and we were confused to find that our list of seed URIs now
> seems to be interpreted as a list of files from which to get seeds.
> 
> The description for seeds (on new.jsp) still says:
> "Fill in seed URIs below, one per line. Comment lines begin with '#'."
> 
> When I view the settings after setting some seeds, however, it says,
> "Seed list too large to edit" under seeds, with the words "seed list"
> linking to what I put in the seeds box.  This happens even if we only
> list one seed.  What is going on?

This is probably the result of a recent bug fix in HEAD.

  [ 1102755 ] seeds text area truncates seeds; big seed lists break config
  http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1102755&group_id=73833&atid=539099

The problem that motivated the change is that the browser textarea
cannot contain very large seed lists -- in fact in some cases a large
list sent back from the server will cause long pauses or rendering
problems on the 'settings' page, and lead to a textarea with truncated
contents.

If the settings page does display, and is then resubmitted, you can
wind up inadvertently losing seeds you'd previously entered.

To guard against this, code was added to disable the textarea
display for seed lists > 32K. That limit is arbitrary; I could
not find a definitive reference for practical browser implementation
limits in this regard.

You shouldn't see this problem listing a single-seed, unless you've got
a ton of non-URL content (comments?) in your entry.

If you are seeing it with tiny seed lists, there's a bug in the fix.

More generally, the method for entering and changing seeds needs
reworking to better support large seed lists via the web UI.

- Gordon
